messages.message:
Updated to the latest master. Looks like it is fixed. I'm seeing more compilation errors :
```    ERROR in ./apps/src/document-refiner/ProjectEditor/DocumentationViewer/style.css (./node_modules/css-loader!./node_modules/sass-loader/lib/loader.js!./apps/src/document-refiner/ProjectEditor/DocumentationViewer/style.css)
    Module build failed (from ./node_modules/sass-loader/lib/loader.js):
    Error: Node Sass does not yet support your current environment: OS X 64-bit with Unsupported runtime (64)```
Yeah me too (on wondernig why travis doesn’t catch). Firs terror fixed on master already, deployment channel caught this a couple hours ago.
oh i dunno about these new ones. Did you upgrade your node?
I'm having the 10.8 version. Lemme refresh my environment and make sure the latest node is picked up
On another note, lets see if we can catch compilation errors in Travis. Looks like this can be done in Travis potentially instead of doing a post checkin test.

I thought we did, but could be wrong. @cross talk - a podcast about crosswords - listen on apple podcasts or spotify @Jessica @John St If you guys could help look into why Travis isn’t compile JS pre-commit, that would be aweseome!
If either of them are around they will be able to debug this better than I will, but I found online that running this fixes it: `npm rebuild node-sass`
which isn't very helpful for us because of our build process...

Even doing doesnt help
```npm install node-sass```
I had to rebuild this locally in order for this to work
Will you be able to hop onto a quick call?
I actually deleted node modules, ran yarn install, and then npm rebuild node-sass
rebuilding node modules fixed the issue. We should integrate this to make file so it'd be easier in the future
